page.title: 18THE MINERS' STRIKE
page.content: The strike affected our school quite a lot because their meeting place was just over the road from our school. At dinner times mums would come for children who went home for dinners because some strikers would wait outside their meeting place for miners coming home from work. One day I walked home along the Avenue and walked passed some miners who were on strike.I felt really scared and wanted to run but thought that they might think that my dad was a miner.They must have been waiting for the miners to come around the corner from work.I turned the corner and heard shouts.The miners were yelling"SCABS!SCABS!SCABS!" I ran home feeling very frightened.
